paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR V122I variant, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: At autopsy, the allele was found to be associated with cardiac TTR amyloid deposition in all the carriers after age 65 years.
The clinical penetrance varies, resulting in substantial heart disease in some carriers and few symptoms in others.
The allele has been found in 10% of African Americans older than age 65 with severe congestive heart failure.

functional_data.summary: The TTR V122I variant is associated with cardiac amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.population_frequency: 0.0173 in the general population, 3.5% in community-dwelling African Americans.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on population studies and clinical observations.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is particularly prevalent in individuals of African descent.
key_quotes: The combination of a highly accurate genetic test and the potential for specific therapy demands a greater awareness of this autosomal dominant, age-dependent cardiac disease in the cardiology community.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
